Recap: (I missed 15 Minutes of the Opening due to a special report.) Ava confronts Olivia again about her father. After Ava leaves Olivia remembers being pregnant and telling the unborn child she was going to give it up. Mallet gets a new assignment. Dinah and Harley talk about ONeill. Looks like Reva comes back from the brink of Death (So much for my recaps on Friday. Sorry folks.). Josh makes plans for all of Reva's friends and family to be at the hospital for a vigil. Cassie hears Josh tell an unconscious Reva to come back to him. Looks like Mallet's assignment is Dinah. Coop and Ava argue about her history. Jonathan and Lizzie dine together and talk about Reva. Lizzie tells Jonathan she loves him. Josh tells Reva to hang on and comeback. That people are out in the hall waiting for her. Mel tells the crowd of well wishers to calm down and stay quiet. Tammy visits Reva and leaves a picture of Jonathan and Lizzie's unborn child with her. Tammy goes to the water to think. While everyone is waiting on Reva, Hawk goes in to visit her. Cassie comes from home with a favorite blanket of Reva's and puts it on the bed. Election Day nears. Buzz warns Coop to stay away from Ava. Ava gets a call from a person arranging a meeting for the next day at 9 A.M. Jonathan tells Lizzie not to play with him, he is going to be there for her and the kid. Remy later looks in on Reva then goes out. Remy later finds Tammy at the lake. Reva wakes up to find Josh holding her hand. Cassie looks in on them. Hears Josh tell Reva to come back to him.
Transcript: Reva: Thought that it would hurt, but there's no pain. Just light. The brightest light. Peaceful. So still. Love you... always. Love you... ...always. ( Heart monitor flatlines )
Josh: No. No.
Cassie: She's gone, Josh. ( Heart monitor flatlines )
Josh: Good-bye, Reva. I love you.
Billy: It's time to go. Come on.
Josh: Yeah. ( Heart monitor flatlines )
[SCENE_BREAK]
Ava: We have to tell him about Reva. Olivia?! They sent me to find you.
Jonathan: Reva?
Lizzie: Wait.
[SCENE_BREAK]
( Heart monitor flatlines )
Cassie: Josh, what is it?
Josh: I think... I think she...
Billy: Josh, just let her go.
Josh: I heard something. Billy, I heard something.
Billy: Josh, it's the machine. She's gone.
Josh: Cassie, I heard something, okay? Reva?
Mel: I'm so sorry. I'm sorry. Time of death...
Josh: Wait, wait, wait. Don't do that! Don't do that, okay? I thought I heard her take a breath.
Mel: Josh, it's not uncommon...
Josh: Can you just check her, please?
Mel: Okay.
Josh: Thank you.
Mel: Just give her some room.
Josh: Is there anything at all?
Mel: Josh, I don't expect to hear anything, okay? Wait a minute.
Josh: There it is. That's it. That's it. See, she's fighting. She's fighting. Come on, Reva, keep on fighting. Keep on fighting, okay? Don't leave us! Stay with us!
Billy: She's alive?
Cassie: I don't understand. The monitors...
Mel: How long was she down?
Josh: Ten seconds, something like that.
Cassie: So what does this mean?
Mel: Well, it may not mean anything. Reva's very weak right now.
Josh: We had said our good- byes. I mean, we were walking away.
Billy: You're just going to keep on fighting, aren't you, girl? Come on.
Cassie: Think she could come back? You think she could come all the way back?
Josh: Well, we can't put it all on her. It's kind of, you know, up to us now. Come on, Reva. Come on, darling.
[SCENE_BREAK]

Lizzie: I want you to take this with you. Just look at it really, really hard and keep this image with you when you go downstairs. Because I know what it's like to lose a parent and the second you walk out this door, nothing is going to be the same for you ever again. And this... this I know is changing everything for you, okay, but she is what you have to remember when you're down there. Because she is hope. Just hold onto that because I think you're going to need it, and I really think that that's what Reva would want. ( Cell phone rings )
Jonathan: It's Cassie.
Lizzie: Jon, you better go.
Jonathan: I want you to come with me.
[SCENE_BREAK]

Frank: Look, I know it's going to be really tough for everybody to keep their heads in the game right now with everything going on with Reva. But you know what? We've got a job to do here. We have two very high profile candidates that need our protection. We're going to make them top priority. Understand that?
Harley: Absolutely.
Mallet: I'll take Blake's security detail.
Frank: Are you sure for the job, with your recent injury and all that? I mean...
Mallet: I just don't want to cover O'Neill's back, if that's all right with you.
Frank: Okay then. We'll pick this up a little later. I've got to do a walkthrough with the commissioner.
Harley: Hey, D, what's up?
Dinah: Are you working?
Harley: Yeah, we're doing election day stuff. Why, what's up?
Dinah: Well, I was speaking to my mother, and we think that the police should keep an eye on Clarissa tomorrow. There are going to be lots of people, lots of crowds and I think that's a good idea.
Harley: Yeah, yeah, yeah, no, no, no, don't worry about it. We've already thought about it, and we're taking extra precautions with the candidates' families, of course.
Dinah: Good, good, good, good, good. So you have someone covering that?
Harley: Including their stepdaughters. Yeah, I do actually have somebody on that. Could you give me one second?
Dinah: Yeah.
Harley: Hey, weren't you looking to do detail in Blake's camp?
Mallet: Uh-huh.
Harley: I think I found you somebody.
[SCENE_BREAK]
Buzz: You know, when Gus was gone, this never went out.
Coop: You know Reva is dying.
Buzz: I know what the doctors said.
Coop: You don't actually believe...
Buzz: Wow, what other choice is there but life? I wish I had a million of these things. Need help now.
Coop: We do. Ava and Olivia.
Buzz: You have hope for them?
Coop: No, but I know you do. Dad, look, we could light a bonfire, and it's not going to make a bit of difference.
[SCENE_BREAK]
Ava: Why did you take off?
Olivia: You had it under control. You told Jonathan about Reva?
Ava: Yeah, I told Jonathan. The sonogram... did it freak you out, when you saw Lizzie looking at her daughter with me there?
Olivia: Yeah. Please, Ava, come on.
Ava: I just... did you ever feel that way with me?
Olivia: Why are you doing this?
Ava: I guess I just thought maybe you could identify with the way she was feeling.
Olivia: I've had sonograms with Emma.
Ava: I know that you hate me. I know that you hate the way you got pregnant, but Olivia, you were carrying me inside of you for nine months. Obviously, I don't remember that, but I know you do.
Olivia: I was miserable the whole time.

Ava: Was there ever one second-- one second-- where maybe you thought that you wanted me? Believe me, I don't really want to ask you this question, but, Olivia, I need to know. Did you... if things were different...
Olivia: Then you wouldn't be here, Ava. That's...
Ava: Okay. When you found out you were pregnant, was there ever, like, a second where you felt like you maybe...
Olivia: Nothing, nothing. I felt nothing. What do you want me to say?
Ava: I don't know.

Olivia: What, I felt you kick and then I got maternal and wanted to go crib shopping and knit booties? That's the movies. In real life-- in my life-- I never felt emptier than when I had you inside of me.
Ava: You had to have feel something?
Olivia: Yes, I felt like throwing myself down a staircase. Lucky for you, I was a little too selfish. I was afraid I'd get hurt.
Ava: Wow. I really need to find out who my father is because any good inside of me certainly didn't come from you.
Olivia: No, it came from a rapist. Somebody who discarded me like yesterday's trash.
Ava: I don't expect a hero in my life.
Olivia: Do I have to remind you of how you got here?
Ava: It's perfectly clear.

Young Olivia: Don't worry, it's just thunder. I see you're kicking up a storm too, huh? Mom always knew what to say to calm me down. Hmm, no more kicking. Good. Because I'm pretty sick of you anyway. Waking me up at night. So don't even try to pull me in. There is no way I'm going to keep you.
[SCENE_BREAK]
Mallet: All right, downtown. This is what we should do at the road blocks.
Harley: No, you are not doing road blocks. Not with that hand. You're with the family.
Mallet: Uh-huh. I know what you're doing.
Gus: What is she doing?
Mallet: I know what you're doing.
Gus: What is everybody doing?
Harley: It's your new assignment. I cleared it with Frank.
Mallet: Dinah isn't one of Blake's kids.
Harley: She's one of Ross's kids, Mallet.
Mallet: But she's not a kid, she's an adult. Which is debatable.
Gus: Look who's talking.
Harley: Hold on.
Mallet: Uh-huh. Uh-huh. See, that's what I'm talking about.
[SCENE_BREAK]
Dinah: What? I'm feeling much better about the whole thing.
Harley: No, you're not.
Dinah: Yes, I am, okay? I think I will stay home tomorrow with Clarissa. She doesn't need to be here. I don't want to make a scene.
Harley: So you waving at me like you're flagging down a plane, that's not making a scene?
Dinah: All right, stop it.
[SCENE_BREAK]
Mallet: There's O'Neill-- big O'Neill-- big shot, standing there with his big swirling drink going, "come on in, let's celebrate." And there I am, I'm standing there, egg, egg, egg.
Gus: Fake blood.
Mallet: What?
Gus: The fake blood that was spilled on your face by Dinah at my house. You've got a little bit by your ear still. You don't wash?
Mallet: Oh, that's great. Great. Thanks for the heads up, man.
Gus: No problem. Now, you going to go over there?
Mallet: No, no. She's with Jeffrey.
Gus: She's with Harley.
Mallet: She's with, with, with Jeffrey.
[SCENE_BREAK]
Dinah: I am not with Jeffrey, with him, with him. I invited him in for a drink. You think a guy could take a hint.
Harley: Wait, you invited... who are we talking about? You invited Mallet in for a drink?
Dinah: Yes.
Harley: You invited Mallet in for a drink? To Jeffrey's room?
Dinah: Yeah. Is that bad?
Harley: Dinah, I'm done. Why don't you just talk to him?
Dinah: No.
[SCENE_BREAK]
Gus: Oh, just go over there, please.
Mallet: Not happening. What?
Harley: You're so grown up, the both of you. This is called meeting halfway.
Gus: As long as you don't let your other garbage get in the way when you're trying to communicate with each other.
Dinah: Look, we don't have to do this.
Mallet: No, it's fine. It's business. Harley said you're worried about your stepsister, Clarissa.
Dinah: I didn't know that you were in charge.
Mallet: Yeah, I didn't know I was in charge either.
Dinah: What?

Mallet: O'Neill is in the spotlight, right? Which means potentially he could be in the crosshairs. And you hang around him all the time, which means you could be in the crosshairs too, right? So tomorrow's a big day, there's a lot going on, all right? I get that you're worried about Clarissa, but who's worrying about you?
Dinah: Well, it sounds like you are worrying about me.
[SCENE_BREAK]
Harley: How many times are we going to have to throw these two together before they stick? They're wasting time.
Gus: Our time.
Harley: They don't realize how lucky they are. Look at Reva. Don't they realize sometimes you don't get a second chance?
Gus: We're going to get a second chance. We're having our baby. I know we are.
[SCENE_BREAK]
Josh: Look at that. Look at that. It's getting stronger. Reva, don't quit on us. Okay, darling, don't quit on us.
Jonathan: What's happening?
Josh: Hey, hey, hey. We thought we lost her, but then she took a breath and now her heart's beating again. It's like she wants to come back to us. Come here, have a seat. Talk to her. Go, go, go!
Jonathan: Hey, Momma, you do your thing, girl. Hey, hey, we're all here. We're like breaking every hospital rule being in here. Hey!
Lizzie: Got room for one more? Two more? I brought this for Reva.
Jonathan: Yeah, come on, come on. We're trying to break a record here.
Josh: Come on in, come on in. In fact, is there anybody else out here? Hello?
Jonathan: Josh, it's not a clown car.

Josh: Here's the thing, here's the thing. Here's what we're going to do, okay? We're going to get the rest of the family here. We're going to get all of Reva's friends, all of the people she's ever worked with-- in fact, maybe we'll get her dentist, and the postman. I don't know, but we're going to set up a schedule, round the clock, 24/7, one, two hour shifts, maybe. Everybody's sort of revolving around so she'll always have someone she loves here. She'll always have someone here fighting with her.
Cassie: Let's do it. Let's do it. I'll make the list.
Josh: Okay. Thank you. Billy, what do you think?
Billy: You hear that, darling? We're circling the wagons for you. ( Laughter )
Jonathan: Have you eaten?
Lizzie: No, not in a while.
Jonathan: I don't know, Company. We'll go to Company and find people there.
Lizzie: No, no, Jonathan, just stay.
Josh: No, no, no, it's fine. Just go, go, go. The more people, the better. Go, go, go!
Bill: I'm going to go downtown.
Josh: Go, go.
Cassie: I'll look around, I'll see who's out here.

Josh: Okay, I'm going to stay here. I'm going to hold down the fort. Okay. Okay. Okay. Come on, darling. You're almost here, you're almost home. Just know that I'm here and I'm waiting with you. So come back to me, Reva. Come back to me. Come on, darling. I can't remember what I was to about to say.
[SCENE_BREAK]

Bradley Cole, "Inside The Light." The day my son was born, well, we almost had the child in the taxicab on the way to the hospital, so that was a little scary. I was in the delivery room, and that is something that I will never forget. When Yoko and I were choosing names for our son, she chose Sean and I really wasn't into it at first because I thought, well, "I already have a wife named Yoko, and I'm going to have to change my name to John Lennon or something." See Jeffrey, Wednesday, November 8, "Inside The Light."
[SCENE_BREAK]
Dinah: So I'm just another assignment?
Mallet: I'm a cop, and I take my job seriously. You know that.
Dinah: Oh, yeah, I know you do.
Mallet: I don't want to fight.
Dinah: I'm not fighting. I don't want to fight either.
Mallet: Okay.
Dinah: The other night you snuck up on me, I spilled some fake blood on you, it was a good time. It was very simple.
Mallet: Yeah. I hope that fake blood didn't ruin my dress. Kidding. It was a joke. And then I delivered you to Jeffrey.
Dinah: Delivered me? I didn't know he was going to be there. And you didn't even stay long enough for me to fix it.
Mallet: Let's just forget it, okay? My job tomorrow is to protect your life, not weigh in on your love life.
Dinah: Fine.
Mallet: Fine.
Dinah: Got it.
Billy: Hey, you two, look, I'm sorry to interrupt, but... I'm interrupting.
[SCENE_BREAK]
Cassie: We'd said our good- byes and we were literally walking out the door and he just knew. Even after Mel told us that it was nearly impossible, he just wouldn't let her go.
Olivia: Josh not letting go of Reva? There's a shock, Cass.
Cassie: What is wrong with you?
Olivia: I don't know. I'm sorry. I'm glad that Reva's still with us.
Cassie: We're looking to bring her positive energy here.
Olivia: Then I'm the wrong girl for you today, okay? I do hope she pulls through. Have you stopped to think about what it'll mean if she does?
Cassie: It'll mean I have my sister back.
Olivia: No, I meant for you and Josh.
Cassie: We're talking about Reva's life.
Olivia: And yours, Cassie.
[SCENE_BREAK]
Ava: She said I make her feel empty inside. I guess I just didn't expect that kind of reaction from her.
Coop: Ava, look, she is not worth any of this, okay? Every single time you push Olivia for answers, you're the one that upsets.
Ava: I'm not upset, I'm mad. I have all of these questions, and I hate it, but she's the only one who can answer them. Questions about my history.

Coop: Look, you know exactly who you are, Ava. And just because you found out that your birth mother is a train wreck doesn't take any of that away. Any history you have with Olivia isn't history worth knowing. That's all I'm going to stay.
Buzz: We got to get back to the hospital.
Coop: Why, is Reva...
Buzz: She's hanging on by a thread. Jonathan and Lizzie are there. I'll explain on the way. ( Cell phone rings )
Ava: Go ahead, it's okay. I'll catch up with you.
Coop: What is it?
Ava: It's just work. I'll take care of it. Go on.
Coop: All right, bye.
Ava: Bye. Alan-Michael.
[SCENE_BREAK]
Lizzie: What is it?

Jonathan: I don't know. I feel like I... I feel like I lucked out today or something. I feel like Reva's going to be around to see her granddaughter because I did a good thing and stood up for the kid like she wanted. I'm sorry, I know that there's really nothing in this for you, but...
Lizzie: What do you mean?

Jonathan: Well, you wanted Coop, you almost had him, but me doing the right thing screwed that up for you. You didn't want this. And I lost Tammy, but you lost, too, you know, and now you're stuck with me. I mean, I'll do my best to give you some kind of life you wanted. I don't see any of Reva's friends. Sorry for pushing that in your face.
Lizzie: No, I'm not upset. I just love you for saying that. I love you, Jonathan.
[SCENE_BREAK]

Josh: Okay, maybe, I went a little overboard, I admit that, sending them out to basically round up the entire world. But look at it this way, it's the kind of thing you would do, right? Something big and something wild, and before you know it, there's going to be a whole bunch of people here, Reva. People who love you and who are going to help you to fight. You're coming back to us, okay? And it doesn't really even matter how many people come here. I mean, maybe the postman won't be able to make it, I don't know, or your dentist, because people have lives, you know, and jobs and responsibilities, but I'm here. I'm here and I'm not leaving. And you can't either. ( Voices outside )
Hawk: I want the next shift, Josh.
Harley: Yeah, count us in.
Dinah: Me, too.
Rusty: Sign me up twice.
Buzz: The Cooper's will take three shifts.
Marina: Hey, make that four.
Mallet and Dinah: Four!
Mel: Listen, this is a hospital, okay? Remember, there are sick people here.
Billy: Not in this room. Not for long, either.
Josh: Thank you all for being here. Thank you so much. This is great.
Rusty: Dylan is on his way, Josh.
Josh: Okay.
Harley: And I am trying to get Susan here.
Gus: And I've got some federal contacts looking for Marah and Shane.
Josh: Thank you, appreciate that.
Frank: And Josh, listen, whatever you need.
Buzz: Yeah, meals are on the house.
Coop: I'm taking orders.
Remy: Tammy brought cold fries.
Josh: Oh, nice.
Tammy: Can I sneak in there now?
Josh: Yeah, just don't tell Hawk that I sent you in first.
Tammy: Okay.
Josh: All right.
Remy: I won't go far.

Tammy: It's a madhouse out there. I wish you could see it, Aunt Reva, all the people here for you. That's how it is when you love somebody. You want to be there with them, and make all of the hurt go away. Oh, this is yours. I love you, Aunt Reva.
[SCENE_BREAK]
Josh: Just calm down, all right? I'll get you in there, I promise. Excuse us for just one second. Thank you for doing this.
Cassie: It's not just me. Everyone here loves her as much as we do.
Josh: I know. I'm sorry that we haven't had any time...
Cassie: It's okay. It's all about Reva right now, okay? Everything else can...
[SCENE_BREAK]

Lizzie: Yes. If I'm not there, give it to Lillian Raines at the nurse station and she'll make sure that Reva gets it. Okay. That is the color that Reva has on her toes. And the florist is going to bring her some daisies.
Jonathan: You don't have to do that.
Lizzie: I wanted to.
Jonathan: I didn't lead you on or anything, did I?

Lizzie: Ah, no. It was nothing that you did. Maybe it was something that you did. We're so in this together. And the way that you will do anything for your baby, even if it means losing something that means so much to you. At first I thought that it was just a stupid crush, and then maybe I had some of that hero worship thing going on since you're protecting me from my granddad.
Jonathan: Sure, that can happen.
Lizzie: But it's the real thing.
Jonathan: Lizzie, I know you and me are married, and I'm going to be there with you for the baby in the long haul-- the whole deal-- but...
Lizzie: "But you're a great girl, Lizzie, and I just don't feel that way about you."
Jonathan: Lizzie...

Lizzie: It's okay. I didn't expect you to. I can't help the way I'm feeling, and you can't change the way you feel. So let's keep working for Reva. I think this one is done. Don't worry, my love it will be all right don't worry, sister say your prayers and sleep tight and it will be fine lover of mine it will be just fine lend our voices only to sounds of freedom no longer lend your strength to that which you wish to be free from lead your lives with love and bravery and you shall lead a life uncommon there are plenty of people that pray for peace but if praying were enough, it would have come to be let your ways enslave no one and the heavens will hush themselves to he the voices ring out clear with sounds of freedom the sounds of freedom come on you unbelievers move out of the way there is a new army coming and we are armed with hate and to live, we must give lend our voices to sounds of freedom no longer lend our strength to that which we wish to be free from lead your lives with love and bravery and you shall lead and lend our voices only to sounds of freedom no longer lend our strength to that which we wish to be free from lead your lives with love and bravery and we shall lead a life uncommon.
[SCENE_BREAK]
Mallet: Sorry.
Dinah: Oh, hi. I have the 3:00 slot.
Mallet: 3:00 is a good time.
Dinah: Yeah. I'm going to watch TV with Reva and catch her up on the soaps.
Mallet: Well, I guess I know what I'm doing tomorrow at 3:00.
Dinah: What?
Mallet: It's election day.
Dinah: Oh, right, I think I'm your project tomorrow.
Mallet: Yeah, yeah, you are. Josh has done an amazing thing here.
Dinah: Yeah. Yeah, it's pretty amazing. Even though they're not together, I guess a feeling like that doesn't go away just because they're apart.
Mallet: Yeah.
Hawk: Lordy, you young'uns always hogging this clipboard. Are you signed up?
Mallet: Yeah. I'm through. I'm leaving. I've got to go to work.
Dinah: Yeah, I have to go to work, too, actually.
Mallet: Yeah. So I guess I'll see you tomorrow.
Dinah: Yeah. What?
Hawk: If you don't know, I'm not telling you.
[SCENE_BREAK]
Buzz: So Ava isn't here yet?
Coop: No. I guess something must have come up at work.
Buzz: I know you told her to steer clear of Olivia.
Coop: Yeah, I know.
Buzz: Well, you know, parents and kids...
Coop: Don't, okay? Look, Ava just needed to be away from this situation. All right?
Buzz: Okay.
[SCENE_BREAK]
( Cell phone rings )

Ava: You said you were going to call me right back. You did? Well, what about him? What... why can't you just tell me right now? Okay. Sure, 9:00, your room, tomorrow. Thank you. Thank you. We can find out about my father. Okay. I'll see you tomorrow.
[SCENE_BREAK]
Jonathan: You finish your meal, and I'll go bring this over there.
Lizzie: Yeah.
Jonathan: I'm sorry.
Lizzie: You don't have to.
Jonathan: I wish there was something different I had to say, but...
Lizzie: You love Tammy and only her.
Jonathan: I'll be a good dad.
Lizzie: And that is enough.
Jonathan: I'm glad you said something.
Lizzie: You're glad? Because I'm freaking mortified.
Jonathan: It used to be you would have kept it to yourself and then try to play me to get what you want from me. Not that I wouldn't have seen through you, but...
Lizzie: It takes one to know one.
Jonathan: It's good that you can just lay it out there now so we can deal.
Lizzie: You bring the best out in me, Jonathan.
Jonathan: Yeah, right.
[SCENE_BREAK]
Remy: I thought you might be here.
Tammy: Well, my shift's not till later, so...
Remy: I saw you in Reva's room. That was a sonogram printout, right? Jonathan and Lizzie's baby?
Tammy: I don't know why I freaked out so much. That baby is Aunt Reva's granddaughter. Why shouldn't she have a sonogram picture of her, right?
Remy: Don't cry over him anymore, Tammy. He's not...

Tammy: Don't say he's not worth it. I'm done crying. I mean, letting go of Jonathan doesn't even seem like that big of a deal when you think about what Aunt Reva did. She was dying, and she still put Uncle Josh and my mom together. Her husband and her sister.
Remy: What you went through is rough, too.

Tammy: It's just about doing the right thing. I mean, Aunt Reva sucked it up and did it even though I'm sure she hated it. I did the right thing, too, for Jonathan and Lizzie. And it's over now, so I really should just stop thinking about it.
Remy: Do you need me here at all? You're doing pretty good at figuring this out on your own.
Tammy: Let's go back to the hospital.
[SCENE_BREAK]
Billy: Hey.
Cassie: Hey.
Billy: You want to go down to the cafeteria with me?
Cassie: You're eating cafeteria food now?
Rusty: No, we're taking the Company food down to the cafeteria. We want to stay close.
Cassie: Now you're thinking. Thank you, but I think I'm just going to stay here. Bring me a burger, maybe?
Billy: You got it.
[SCENE_BREAK]
Josh: Reva, that's right, darling. You can come on home now.
Reva: Heaven?
Josh: Springfield. Sorry. You're here with me. But I knew you would come back. Save your strength, okay? See, you can't leave me. You belong here. I'll never let you go.
[SCENE_BREAK]
Next, on "Guiding Light"...
Jeffrey: Have you seen the polls? Blake is going to get crushed.
Blake: Come on, it's election day. I'm behind in the polls. I have to get out there.
Jeffrey: I get to become mayor, so that means you have to find a new bed to sleep in.
Ava: You said you had news for me. Did they find out who my father is?
Olivia: I can't let that happen.
Transcript Author: Provided by Boo Proofread by Tanya
